text.name: sys_description
text.text: This handheld was developed by Epyx and released by Atari Corporation in 1987. Eventually, Epyx would be acquired by Atari in 1989, with Atari taking over all development of the system. Equipped with a 4MHz CPU, a 16MHz GPU with 3D support and 64KB of RAM, it used a 480x102 display with 16 colors. In 1991, the "Lynx II" was released, featuring a better display and a power saving mode. The console itself featured buttons on the top and bottom, allowing games to be played in portrait. It also featured linked play up to 8 players.
